Problem:
Given a linear system governed by the differential equation \( \dot{x} = Mx \), where \( M \) is a constant matrix, consider examining the impact of the linear transformation \( T(x) = Qx \) for a matrix \( Q \). We investigate how this affects the system across different time points.

Can we determine the original vector \( x_0 \) at t = 0 after observing \( x(t) \) at t = T without knowing whether \( T(x) \) was applied?
Explanation: Without knowledge of the application of \( T(x) \), reconstructing \( x_0 \) uniquely is impossible as \( Q \) could have altered \( x_0 \) to any vector within the range of \( Q \). This introduces an ambiguity in tracing back the original state.
